page.title: 12MINERS STRIKE 1984/85
page.content: The mining communities of Mountain Ash and Aberfan were seriously affected by the miners'strike.Families on strike, were without pay for almost a year and many had problems paying the every day household bills such as mortgages, electricity,gas and food.People were to be seen outside supermarkets, collecting tins and other various items of food. These were then taken to special distribution centres and shared out amongst mining families. All of the miners' children in our school had free meals during the strike even in the school holidays. Toys were collected for Christmas presents and some children in our town had holidays paid for them by miners and trade unionists in other countries such as France and Belgium.
